items.message:
Heavy rainfall continues to move in from the North Sea and will persist overnight. River flooding is possible as river levels rise through Saturday night and into Sunday morning.

Areas most at risk include riverside footpaths and low-lying land and roads. Areas of particular concern include Belford and Waren Mill. 

Rainfall is expected to become lighter and more showery during late Sunday morning 14/07/24. River levels are expected to peak later Sunday. At this stage, we do not expect any property flooding from rivers.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels closely. 

We advise residents to remain vigilant to the possibility of flooding. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

This message will be updated by 10:00 Sunday 14/07/24.

River levels in the River Rye catchment are expected to rise overnight in response to prolonged rainfall. As a result, flooding of low lying land and roads adjacent to watercourses is possible in the Rye catchment, particularly around Ness overnight tonight and into tomorrow morning, Sunday 14th July.  We currently expect river levels in the area to peak on Sunday afternoon or evening. We are not expecting to issue flood warnings in this area at this time. However we will monitor the situation and update this message should the situation change. Further showers and unsettled weather is expected to continue into next week.
Take care on roads and paths near watercourses which may be flooded. 
We will update this message by 0900 on Sunday 14th July

River levels in the River Esk catchment are expected to rise overnight in response to prolonged rainfall. As a result, flooding of low lying land and roads adjacent to watercourses is possible in the Esk catchment, particularly around Lealholm overnight tonight and tomorrow morning, Sunday 14th July.  We currently expect river levels in the area to peak on Sunday afternoon or evening. We are not expecting to issue flood warnings in this area at this time. However we will monitor the situation and update this message should the situation change. Further showers and unsettled weather is expected to continue into next week. 
Take care on roads and paths near watercourses which may be flooded. 
We will update this message by 0900 on Sunday 14th July.

Heavy rainfall continues to move in from the North Sea and will persist over Saturday night and into Sunday morning. 

River flooding is possible between 21:00 Saturday 13/07/24 through to Sunday afternoon 14/07/24. Areas most at risk include riverside footpaths and low-lying land and roads. At this stage, we do not expect any property flooding from rivers.

Rainfall is expected to become lighter and more showery during late Sunday morning 14/07/24. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels closely. Environment Agency teams are on standby ready to mobilise if needed.

We advise residents to remain vigilant to the possibility of flooding. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

This message will be updated by 10:00 Sunday 14/07/24.

items.description: Coastal Streams in Redcar and Cleveland
items.message:
Heavy rainfall continues to move in from the North Sea and will persist over Saturday night.

Rainfall is expected to become lighter and more showery during late Sunday morning 14/07/24. 

River levels are expected to peak later on Sunday 14/07/24. 

Areas most at risk of river flooding include riverside footpaths and low-lying land and roads. At this stage, we do not expect any property flooding from rivers.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels closely. We anticipate rainfall will be less intense than on Tuesday night (09/07/24). Environment Agency teams are on standby ready to mobilise to Skinningrove and Loftus if needed.

We advise residents to remain vigilant to the possibility of flooding. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 10:00 Sunday 14/07/24.
